meanings.definition: The action of emerging or coming to the surface.
meanings.sent1: The surfacing of the submarine was a thrilling moment for the crew.
meanings.sent2: The surfacing of the sun after a storm brought warmth and light to the land.
meanings.sent3: The surfacing of the shy turtle from its shell made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The surfacing of new ideas in the meeting sparked creativity among the team.
meanings.sent5: The sudden surfacing of memories flooded her mind with nostalgia.

meanings.definition: The act of providing a surface or finishing a surface.
meanings.sent1: The surfacing of the table with a fresh coat of paint made it look brand new.
meanings.sent2: The surfacing of the road with smooth asphalt improved the driving experience.
meanings.sent3: The surfacing of the cake with colorful sprinkles delighted the birthday girl.
meanings.sent4: The surfacing of the wall with graffiti gave the alley a vibrant look.
meanings.sent5: The careful surfacing of the wood with varnish enhanced its natural beauty.

meanings.definition: The material used to cover or finish a surface.
meanings.sent1: The surfacing of the floor with tiles made it easy to clean.
meanings.sent2: The surfacing of the roof with shingles protected the house from rain.
meanings.sent3: The surfacing of the book with a shiny cover caught the reader's eye.
meanings.sent4: The surfacing of the car with a glossy paint gave it a sleek appearance.
meanings.sent5: The surfacing of the wall with wallpaper added a touch of elegance to the room.
